SENT.plain: Percutaneous transluminal angioplasty (PTA) of carotid arteries has been rarely reported
Dilatation of internal carotid artery stenosis has so far been performed only for fibromuscular dysplasia
Because of the risk of cerebral embolization the technique has not been used for arteriosclerotic stenosis, particularly since endarterectomy is known as a safe procedure
Three cases are reported of successful dilatation of arteriosclerotic internal carotid artery stenosis
A neurologic complication occurred in one patient
The primary indication for performing PTA in such cases is limited operability for medical reasons
